title: Variables
summary: Variables are like containers that store values/data. This allows you to label data with a descriptive name, so our programs can be understood more clearly by the reader and ourselves. Think of it like a box with a label on it.
sample_question: In your own words, why do we use variables instead of just writing numbers directly?

title: Loops
summary: Loops allow code to be executed repeatedly based on a condition. For loops are used when you know how many times to repeat, while While loops run as long as a condition is true.
sample_question: What is the main difference between a For loop and a While loop?

title: Functions
summary: Functions are reusable blocks of code designed to perform a single, related action. They help reduce repetition and make code easier to read and debug.
sample_question: Why is it better to use a function rather than copy-pasting code?
